text: - My name is Sherry Karamdashti.

I'm a sales director for
our AWS startup team.
I've been with AWS almost nine years.
June will be my nine-year anniversary.

So AWS, first, our customers
were really startups.
They were the first adopter of AWS
and doing innovative things

and we have startups that I
worked with nine years ago
that were just starting
and now they are big enterprise customers.

The advice I would give
myself nine years ago
is be open to new things.
I considered myself open to new things

but when you come here,
you really have to be open
'cause we are changing the world
and our customers are changing the world.

So really embracing new
processes, new innovations,
new way of thinking.

You know, things today
like machine learning or AI

that has become such a
broad external trends

that are becoming core
to many of our customers
is a big thing.

So working for AWS startups
is gives you an opportunity,
one, to work with new companies

that are just starting to
build and doing great things.

Second, I think our
team is very passionate
and has a lot of empathy for our startups.

We have a lot of ex
founders, we have former CTOs
that are in our solution architecture team

that are really helping startups
build scalable technology.
So you're surrounded by folks

that have a high empathy
and knowledge of startups.

So if you don't know it,
you're gonna learn it
from others really fast.
If I were to look at my long career,

I would say that I've been
able to do my best work here.

And I've been really
supported by great leaders
and just working with great customers
that gives me a lot of satisfaction.
(upbeat music)
